blog.name: tony-has-anxietyattacks-so-do-i
blog.title: I LOVE YOU 3000

summary:
I know he is one of the good guys. I know he did his best in endgame, I don't hate him.
But he has a tendency to leave people...
body:
Cap was being selfish as hell in Endgame

I know he is one of the good guys. I know he did his best in endgame, I don’t hate him.

But he has a tendency to leave people behind. In civil war, He left Tony and half of the team to save Bucky (and hell guys I love Bucky he deserves the world) and he broke laws and stuff, even tho Tony gave him a choice not to and tried his best to keep the team together.

And then in endgame, after everything comes to peace he left Bucky behind. He left that poor broken soul right after the end of the damn universe. He went off to marry his best girl. Okay of course he deserves “a happy ending” but he was being selfish as hell. You don’t just leave your best friend without a notice. You don’t just walk away from people who called you family and stood beside you to have your very own little happy ending.

Tony didn’t. He had a fucking child for God’s sake yet he fought a fucking grape from the outer fucking space. He risked his happy ending. He risked a five year old’s happy ending, he risked his wife’s happy ending.

And he died doing it. He died knowing that he was probably not gonna come out alive this time. Yet he still fucking did it to save the universe.

Even a five year old was mature enough to know that “this is the end game, we must be strong for each other.”

What did Cap do? He left his family behind, he left Bucky behind, he left those heart broken, mourning people behind and did what? Married the love of his life.

Maybe you think he deserved it but not everybody get what they deserve.

The whole Stark family didn’t. Natasha didn’t. Loki didn’t. Bucky didn’t. Thor didn’t. Hulk didn’t.

Excuse me Rogers but take that suit off, what are you?

blog.name: melty94
blog.title: Professional Dork.
blog.description: Art blog @melty-artz!

summary: You're probably getting a lot of these but I'm really glad I'm not the only one who can't stand what happened to Tony, Steve and...
question: You're probably getting a lot of these but I'm really glad I'm not the only one who can't stand what happened to Tony, Steve and Thor. Tony especially. I feel like it works as an ending for him but it's not the ONLY satisfying conclusion to his arc. I hope someday you can grace us with some happier-ending picture because I could do with one but tbh, you come first, I hope you're doing well while dealing with it. I never thought I'd actually grieve for a character but Tony is special, isn't he..?
answer:
Oh no I definitely feel you. I feel like those three’s character arcs were majorly disregarded in this movie. 

Tony’s death (in my opinion) felt like it was meaningless and in vain because it was so avoidable. (for starters both Captain Marvel AND Thor were there.) Not to mention the timestone…that Thanos used to heal himself…in infinity war….after Thor gutted him through. ._.

It just didn’t seem like Tony was the last stand between them and Thanos. He absolutely didn’t have to die and the fact that they went that route is incredibly unsatisfying after watching this character grow and evolve all these years, it feels like they threw his development away saying, “you can only rest when you’re dead.” like, no. 

Honestly I feel like a more powerful ending would’ve been Tony having to let go of the illusion of control (of wanting to save the world), or being so injured he has to give up the mantel of Iron Man. Not only does he learn to let go of the illusion of control, but he chooses family, choose retirement, chooses to leave it to the younger generation. Something finally matters more to him than Iron Man.

Okay I’m ranting a bit haha but the point is I get you. It wasn’t necessary and it certainly wasn’t the only way to end his character arc. Marvel effed up majorly here and it’s frustrating to watch him develop for eleven years to get…. this. 


Don’t worry, got my own little artworks planned. :) You’re right, Tony is definitely something, there’s a reason why his character has resonated so soundly with so many people! <3

title: Spider-Man: The Spider of Thunder
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Jm3b4g

by MarvelQueen117

Peter Parker scores an internship at Stark Tower when he only wanted to meet his biological parents and enjoy the field trip but ends up joining the Avengers in a deadly fight to stop Ultron’s plan to wipe out life on Earth.

Can Pepper and Tony keep their son alive and in doing so… will they go too far when they secretly develop a cure to eradicate Spider cells from his blood?

Words: 2003, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel Movies), Marvel Cinematic Universe, Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017)

summary: trying to do what's best (for a kid who's lost control)
title: trying to do what's best (for a kid who's lost control)
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Hre0yH

by ShaytheVGA

ENDGAME SPOILERS GUYS ENDGAME SPOILERS

 

 

 

 

Peter’s been having nightmares.


They’re not just his usual nightmares, not the ones where he holds Uncle Ben in his hands because he is too late, or the ones where he’s pinned under a pile of rubble and he can’t get out, no matter how hard he tries, or not even the ones where he gets home and finds Aunt May dead, killed by some second-rate villain who just happened to get lucky.
 



No, these nightmares are so, so much worse.

 


 
 


Peter is coping with the events of Endgame. It’s not going that well.

Words: 2957, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 1 of what comes next

summary: I'd just like to say 3 things in favour of Iron husbands, a severally underrated ship
body:
I’d just like to say 3 things in favour of Iron husbands, a severally underrated ship

Iron husbands : Tony x Rhodey

1 - Anthony E. Stark calls James Rhodes “Rhodey,” which is the man’s last name but with a part of Tony’s first name in it.

2 - James Rhodes calls Tony Stark “Tones,” which is the man’s first name but with a part of Rhodey’s last name in it.

3 - In Iron Man the first, Tony calls Rhodey “Sourpatch” on the plane, a thing I never noticed until recently (as Tony was talking quickly and Rhodey had muttered hiso answer) and only because I listened very closely to what they were saying. Automatically, Rhodey said “Not sour,” which means that this is an old argument. And they both said their replicas in less then 1.5 second.

Do not expect me to say something deep about this or anything, I’m not here to meta properly because there are people who are better at this than me and from Iron Man to End Game (the movie that we kinda wish we could unsee now) there are a lot of things one could talk about, which I won’t.

I just wanted to point out the name thing, the third one is a bonus. :)

3 - In Iron Man the first, Tony calls Rhodey “Sourpatch” on the plane, a thing I never noticed until recently (as Tony was talking quickly and Rhodey had muttered hiso answer) and only because I listened very closely to what they were saying. Automatically, Rhodey said “Not sour,” which means that this is an old argument. And they both said their replicas in less then 1.5 second.

Do not expect me to say something deep about this or anything, I’m not here to meta properly because there are people who are better at this than me and from Iron Man to End Game (the movie that we kinda wish we could unsee now) there are a lot of things one could talk about, which I won’t.

I just wanted to point out the name thing, the third one is a bonus. :)
